definition: Yueyang Tower, famous beauty spot in Yueyang, north Hunan, overlooking Dongting Lake 洞庭湖[Dong4 ting2 Hu2]/one of three famous pagodas in China along with Yellow Crane Tower 黃鶴樓|黄鹤楼[Huang2 he4 Lou2] in Wuhan, Hubei and Tengwang Tower 滕王閣|滕王阁[Teng2 wang2 Ge2] in Nanchang, Jiangxi
surname Yue
wife's parents and paternal uncles
positive (electric.)/sun/male principle (Taoism)/Yang, opposite: 陰|阴[yin1]
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
surname Lou
Yueyang Tower district of Yueyang city 岳陽|岳阳[Yue4 yang2], Hunan
On Yueyang Tower (1045), essay by Song writer Fan Zhongyan 范仲淹[Fan4 Zhong4 yan1]

sentences.english: YHTCM, with the opportunity of developing the scenery belt along the Dongting Lake.
sentences.chinese: 以啓動沿湖風光帶岳陽樓核心景區建設爲發展契機。

sentences.english: Then the Yueyang Building was renovated, increasing the original scale and carving on its wall with the poems and verses written by the Masters in the Tang Dynasty and contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 乃重修岳陽樓，增其舊制，刻唐賢今人詩賦於其上。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the main architecture of the Tower was formed.
sentences.chinese: 岳陽樓功能的變遷，也是其建築主體風格形成時期。

booklet/brochure/(old) book (made of bamboo strips tied together)
